1.verse: Paul— an apostle not from humans nor through a human, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, the One having raised Him from the dead—

2.verse: and all the brothers with me, to the churches of Galatia:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

4.verse: the One having given Himself for our sins so that He might rescue us out of the present evil age in accordance with the will of our God and Father,

5.verse: to Whom be the glory forever and ever, amen.

6.verse: Are You Turning Away From The Gospel I Received Through a Revelation From Christ? - I am marveling that you are so quickly turning-away from the One having called you by the grace of Christ to a different good-news—

7.verse: which is not another [good news]— except there are some disturbing you and intending to change the good-news of Christ.

8.verse: But even if we or an angel from heaven should announce-a-good-news to you other-than what we announced-as-good-news to you, let him be accursed.

9.verse: As we have said-before I am also now saying again— if anyone is announcing-a-good-news-to you other-than what you received, let him be accursed.

10.verse: For am I now trying to win-approval-of  humans or God? Or am I seeking to please humans? If I were still seeking to please humans, I would not be a slave of Christ!

11.verse: For I make-known to you, brothers, as to the good-news having been announced-as-good-news by me, that it is not according-to a human.

12.verse: For I neither received it from a human, nor was I taught it, but I received it through a revelation of  Jesus Christ.

13.verse: For When God Was Pleased To Reveal Himself To Me, I Conferred With No One - For you heard-of my former conduct in Judaism— that I was persecuting the church of God extremely, and destroying it.

14.verse: And I was advancing in Judaism beyond many contemporaries in my nation, being far more a zealot for the traditions of my fathers.

15.verse: But when God— the One having separated me from my mother’s womb and having called me through His grace— was well-pleased

16.verse: to reveal His Son in me in order that I might be announcing Him as good news among the Gentiles, I did not immediately communicate with flesh and blood,

17.verse: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to the apostles before me, but I went away to Arabia and returned back to Damascus.

18.verse: Three Years Later I Went To Jerusalem And Visited Peter And James - Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Cephas, and stayed with him fifteen days.

19.verse: But I did not see another of the apostles except James, the brother of the Lord.

20.verse: Now the things which I am writing to you, behold— I affirm in the sight of God that I am not lying.

21.verse: Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.verse: And I was not-known by face to the churches of Judea in Christ,

23.verse: but they were only hearing that “the one once persecuting us is now announcing-as-good-news the faith which he was once destroying”.

24.verse: And they were glorifying God in me.

1.verse: Fourteen Years Later The Jerusalem Apostles Added Nothing To My Gospel - Then after fourteen years I again went up to Jerusalem with Barnabas, having also taken along Titus with me.

2.verse: And I went up based-on a revelation, and laid-before them the good-news which I am proclaiming among the Gentiles— but privately, to the ones having-the-reputation-of  being something— that somehow I might not be running, or have run, in vain.

3.verse: But not even Titus, the one with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.

4.verse: Now this arose because of the false-brothers secretly-brought-in, who sneaked-in to spy-out our freedom which we have in Christ Jesus in order that they might enslave us—

5.verse: to whom we yielded in submission not-even for an hour, in order that the truth of the good-news might continue with you.

6.verse: And from the ones having-the-reputation-of being something— of-what-sort they ever were makes no difference to me; God does not receive the face of a human— indeed to me the ones having-the-reputation communicated nothing.

7.verse: But on-the-contrary, having seen that I have been entrusted the good-news for the uncircumcised just as Peter for the circumcised—

8.verse: for the One having worked in Peter for an apostleship of the circumcised worked also in me for the Gentiles—

9.verse: and having recognized the grace having been given to me, James and Cephas and John, the ones having-the-reputation-of being pillars, gave the right hands of fellowship to me and Barnabas, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.

10.verse: They asked only that we should be remembering the poor— as to which, I also was eager to do this very thing.

11.verse: In Antioch I Rebuked Peter When He Erred With Respect To Gentile Christians - And when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face— because he was condemned.

12.verse: For before certain ones came from James, he was eating with the Gentiles. But when they came, he was drawing-back and separating himself, fearing the ones of the circumcision.

13.verse: And the other Jews also joined-in-hypocrisy with him, so that even Barnabas was carried-away by their hypocrisy.

14.verse: But when I saw that they were not walking-straight with regard to the truth of the good-news, I said to Cephas in front of everyone— “If you being a Jew are living Gentile-ly and not Jewish-ly, how is it you are compelling the Gentiles to Judaize?”

15.verse: Even We Jews Are Declared Righteous By Faith In Christ, Not By Works of The Law - We are Jews by nature, and not sinners from the Gentiles.

16.verse: But knowing that a person is not declared-righteous by works of the Law except through faith in Jesus Christ, even we believed in Christ Jesus, in order that we might be declared-righteous by faith in Christ and not by works of the Law, because by works of the Law no flesh will be declared-righteous.

17.verse: And We Died To The Law As a Rule of Life, And Now Live By Faith In The Son of God - But if  while seeking to be declared-righteous in Christ, we also ourselves were found to be sinners, is then Christ a minister of sin? May it never be!

18.verse: For if I am building again these things which I tore-down, I am demonstrating myself to be a transgressor.

19.verse: For through the Law I died to the Law in order that I might live to God. I have been crucified-with Christ!

20.verse: And I no longer am living, but Christ is living in me. And what I am now living in the flesh, I am living by faith in the Son of God— the One having loved me and handed Himself over for me.

21.verse: I am not setting-aside the grace of God! For if righteousness comes through the Law, then Christ died without-a-reason!

1.verse: Who Has Bewitched You? Do You Live By The Spirit And Faith, Or The Flesh And Law? - O foolish Galatians, who bewitched you, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was portrayed as crucified?

2.verse: I want to learn only this from you: did you receive the Spirit by works of the Law or by the hearing of  faith?

3.verse: Are you so foolish? Having begun-with the Spirit are you now perfecting-yourselves with the flesh?

4.verse: Did you suffer so many things in-vain— if indeed it really was in-vain?

5.verse: Did then the One supplying you the Spirit and working miracles among you do it because-of  works of the Law, or because-of the hearing of faith?

6.verse: The Children of Abraham Are The Ones Living By Faith, Not By The Law - Just as Abraham “ believed God and it was credited to him for righteousness” [Gen 15:6],

7.verse: know then that the ones of  faith— these are the sons of Abraham.

8.verse: Now the Scripture, having foreseen that God declares the Gentiles righteous by faith, announced-the-good-news-beforehand to Abraham: that “All the Gentiles will be blessed in you”[Gen 12:3].

9.verse: So then the ones of faith are being blessed together-with Abraham, the man-of-faith.

10.verse: For all-who are of the works of the Law are under a curse, for it has been written that “Cursed is everyone who is not continuing-in all the things having been written in the book of the Law, that he might do them”[Deut 27:26].

11.verse: And that no one is declared-righteous by the Law before God is evident, because “The righteous one will live by faith” [Hab 2:4].

12.verse: But the Law is not of faith, but “The one having done these things shall live by them” [Lev 18:5].

13.verse: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the Law, having become a curse for us— because it has been written, “Cursed is everyone hanging on a tree” [Deut 21:23]—

14.verse: in order that the blessing of  Abraham might come to the Gentiles in Christ Jesus, in order that we might receive the promise of  the Spirit through faith.

15.verse: God’s Promises To Abraham Were Not Cancelled By The Law Which Came Later - Brothers, I speak in accordance with human thinking: Though it is [a covenant] of a human, no one sets-aside or adds-conditions-to a covenant having been ratified.

16.verse: Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed. He does not say [in Gen 13:15] “and to seeds”, as-though speaking in reference to many; but as-though speaking in reference to one, “and to your seed”— who is Christ.

17.verse: And this I say: the Law, having come-about after four-hundred and thirty years, does not un-ratify the covenant having been previously-ratified by God, so as to do-away-with the promise.

18.verse: For if the inheritance is of  the Law, it is no longer of the promise. But God has freely-given it to Abraham through the promise!

19.verse: The Law Was Added Because of Transgressions, Until The Christ Should Come - Why then the Law? It was added because of the transgressions until which time the Seed should come to Whom the promise has been made, having been commanded through angels by the hand of a mediator.

20.verse: Now a mediator is not [a mediator] of [only] one [party], but God is one.

21.verse: The Law Served To Lead Us To Faith In Christ So As To Inherit The Abrahamic Promises - Is the Law then against the promises of God? May it never be! For if a Law being able to give-life had been given, righteousness really would have been by the Law!

22.verse: But the Scripture confined all things under sin, in order that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to the ones believing.

23.verse: And before the faith came, we were being kept-in-custody under the Law— being confined until the faith destined to be revealed.

24.verse: So then the Law has been our tutor leading-to Christ, in order that we might be declared-righteous by faith.

25.verse: But the faith having come, we are no longer under a tutor!

26.verse: For you all are sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus!

27.verse: For all you who were baptized into Christ put-on Christ.

28.verse: There is no Jew nor Greek, there is no slave nor free, there is no male and female. For you all are one in Christ Jesus.

29.verse: And if you are Christ’s, then you are seed of Abraham— heirs according-to the promise.

1.verse: God Sent His Son To Redeem Us So We All Could Be Adopted As Sons And Heirs - Now I say— for as much time as the heir is a child, he is no different from a slave. Being the [future] owner of all,

2.verse: nevertheless he is under guardians and stewards until the pre-appointed day of the father.

3.verse: In this manner also we, when we were children, were enslaved under the elemental things of the world.

4.verse: But when the fullness of time came, God sent-forth His Son— having come from a woman, having come under the Law

5.verse: in order that He might redeem the ones under the Law, in order that we [all] might receive the adoption.

6.verse: And because you are sons, God sent-forth the Spirit of His Son into our hearts crying-out, “Abba! Father!”

7.verse: So then you are no longer a slave, but a son— and if a son, also an heir through God!

8.verse: Why Turn Back To Being Slaves Again? I Fear For You - But at that time not knowing God, you were-slaves to the ones by nature not being gods.

9.verse: But now having known God, yet rather having been known by God, how is it you are turning-back again to the weak and poor elemental things to which again you are wanting to be-slaves anew?

10.verse: You are observing days and months and seasons and years.

11.verse: I am fearing for you, that I somehow have labored in-vain for you.

12.verse: I Beg You, Become As I Am. Have I Become Your Enemy By Speaking The Truth To You? - I beg you, brothers, become as I, because I also became as you. You did me no wrong.

13.verse: And you know that I first announced-the-good-news to you because of a weakness of the flesh.

14.verse: And you did not treat-with-contempt nor loathe your trial in-connection-with my flesh, but you welcomed me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus.

15.verse: Where then is your blessedness? For I testify concerning you that, if possible, you would have given your eyes to me, having torn them out!

16.verse: So then, have I become your enemy while speaking-the-truth to you?

17.verse: They are zealously-seeking you— not commendably, but they want to shut you out in-order-that you might be zealously-seeking them.

18.verse: I Am Again Suffering Birth Pains For You Until Christ Is Formed In You - Now it is good to be zealously-sought in a commendable thing at-all-times, and not only during my being present with you—

19.verse: my children, as to whom again I am suffering-birth-pains until which time Christ is formed in you.

20.verse: But I was [just now] wishing to be present with you now and to change my tone, because I am perplexed with you.

21.verse: Listen To The Law. We Are Children of The Free Promise, Not of The Slave Covenant - Tell me, the ones wanting to be under the Law, do you not hear the Law?

22.verse: For it has been written that Abraham had two sons— one by the slave-woman and one by the free woman.

23.verse: But the one by the slave-woman has been born according to the flesh, and the one by the free woman through the promise—

24.verse: which things are being allegorized, for these women are two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai, bearing children for slavery, which is Hagar

25.verse: (now Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia). And she corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is a slave with her children.

26.verse: But the Jerusalem above is free— which is our mother.

27.verse: For it has been written, “Celebrate, barren one, the one not giving-birth. Break-forth and shout, the one not suffering-birth-pains. Because many more are the children of the desolate than of the one having the husband!”[Isa 54:1]

28.verse: And you, brothers, are children of the promise in accordance with Isaac.

29.verse: But just as at-that-time the one having been born according to the flesh was persecuting the one born according to the Spirit, so also now.

30.verse: But what does the Scripture say? “Send-out the slave-woman and her son. For the son of the slave-woman shall by no means inherit with the son of the free woman” [Gen 21:10].

31.verse: Therefore, brothers, we are not children of a slave-woman, but of the free woman.

1.verse: Christ Set Us Free, So Stand Firm In Faith. If You Pursue The Law, Christ Will Not Profit You - Christ set us free for freedom. Therefore be standing-firm, and do not again be held-in a yoke of slavery.

2.verse: Behold— I, Paul, say to you that if you receive-circumcision, Christ will profit you nothing.

3.verse: And I testify again to every man receiving-circumcision that he is a debtor to do the whole Law.

4.verse: You who are [trying to be] declared-righteous by the Law were alienated from Christ. You fell-from grace.

5.verse: For by  the Spirit, by faith, we are eagerly-awaiting the hope of righteousness.

6.verse: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision can-do anything, but faith working through love.

7.verse: Who Hindered You From Believing The Truth? He Will Bear His Judgment - You were running well. Who hindered you that you should not be persuaded by the truth?

8.verse: The persuasion is not from the One calling you!

9.verse: A little leaven leavens the whole lump.

10.verse: I am persuaded with reference to you in the Lord that you will think no other thing. But the one disturbing you will bear the judgment, whoever he may be.

11.verse: But I, brothers, if I am still proclaiming circumcision, why am I still being persecuted? Then the offense of  the cross has been abolished.

12.verse: O-that the ones upsetting you would indeed cut-themselves-off !

13.verse: Use Your Freedom To Serve One Another In Love, Not As an Opportunity For The Flesh - For you were called for freedom, brothers, only do not use the freedom for an opportunity for the flesh, but be serving one another through love.

14.verse: For the whole Law has been fulfilled in one saying— in the “You shall love your neighbor as yourself ” [Lev 19:18].

15.verse: But if you are biting and devouring one another, watch out that you may not be consumed by one another!

16.verse: Walk By The Spirit And You Will Not Fulfill The Flesh’s Desires Or Be Under The Law - And I say— be walking by the Spirit and you will never fulfill the desire of the flesh.

17.verse: For the flesh desires against the Spirit and the Spirit against the flesh. For these are contrary to one another in-order-that you might not be doing these things which you may be wanting.

18.verse: But if you are being led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.

19.verse: Those Who Practice The Works of The Flesh Will Not Inherit God’s Kingdom - Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are sexual-immorality, impurity, sensuality,

20.verse: idolatry, sorcery, hostilities, strife, jealousy, rages, selfish-interests, dissentions, factions,

21.verse: envy, drunkenness, revelries, and the things like these— as to which things I tell you beforehand, just as I said-before, that the ones practicing such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.

22.verse: Those In Christ Crucified The Flesh And Bear The Fruit of Living By The Spirit - But the fruit of  the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,

23.verse: gentleness, self-control. Against such things there is no law.

24.verse: And the ones of  Christ Jesus crucified the flesh, with its passions and desires.

25.verse: If we are living by the Spirit, let us also be walking-in-line with the Spirit.

26.verse: Don’t Be Conceited. Humbly Care For One Another And You Will Fulfill Christ’s Law - Let us not become conceited ones, challenging one another, envying one another.

1.verse: Brothers, even if a person is overtaken in some trespass, you spiritual ones be restoring such a one in a spirit of gentleness, looking-out-for yourself that you also not be tempted.

2.verse: Be carrying one another’s burdens, and in this manner you will fulfill the law of Christ.

3.verse: For if anyone thinks that he is something while being nothing, he is deceiving himself.

4.verse: Each Person Has a Boast Only With Reference To His Own Proven Work - But let each one prove his own work— and then he will have the boast with reference to himself alone, and not with reference to the other person.

5.verse: For each one will carry his own load.

6.verse: We Will Reap What We Sow. Plant Good Works To Reap a Good Harvest - And let the one being instructed-in the word share with the one instructing in all good things.

7.verse: Do not be deceived— God is not mocked. For whatever a person sows, this he will also reap.

8.verse: Because the one sowing to his own flesh will reap decay from the flesh. But the one sowing to the Spirit will reap eternal life from the Spirit.

9.verse: And let us not grow-weary while doing good. For in His own time we not losing-heart will reap.

10.verse: So then, while we have opportunity, let us be working good to everyone, but especially to the family-members of the faith.

11.verse: Those Wanting Your Circumcision Are Seeking To Boast In Your Flesh, Not To Keep The Law - See with what large letters I wrote to you with my own hand!

12.verse: All who want to make-a-good-showing in the flesh— these ones are compelling you to receive-circumcision only in order that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.

13.verse: For not even the ones receiving-circumcision themselves are keeping the Law. But they want you to receive-circumcision in order that they might boast in your flesh.

14.verse: I Will Boast Only In The Cross of Christ. Peace Be Upon All Who Do The Same - But for me, may it never be that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.verse: For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is anything, but a new creation.

16.verse: And all who will walk-in-line with this standard— peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.

17.verse: Henceforth let no one be causing troubles for me. For I bear the brand-marks of Jesus on my body.

18.verse: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers. Amen.
